question: William wants to make different sized ice cubes with 216 ounces of water. He can make giant cubes that use 4 ounces per cube, medium cubes that use 3 ounces, and small cubes that use 1/3 ounce. If he makes 7 giant cubes, 10 medium cubes, and 24 small cubes, how many ounces of water does he have left?
answer:
The giant cubes used up 28 ounces of water because 7 times 4 equals <<7*4=28>>28.
The medium cubes used up 30 ounces of water because 10 times 3 equals <<10*3=30>>30.
The small cubes used up 8 ounces of water because 24 times 1/3 equals 8.
This means that William has used up 66 ounces of water because 28 plus 30 plus 8 equals 66.
William has 150 ounces of water left because 216 minus 66 equals <<216-66=150>>150.
#### 150
